act-rules.title: ARIA attribute is defined in WAI-ARIA

frontmatter.name: ARIA attribute is defined in WAI-ARIA
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `aria-` attribute specified is defined in ARIA 1.2.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: ARIA state or property has valid value

frontmatter.name: ARIA state or property has valid value
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each ARIA state or property has a valid value type.

aria12:propcharacteristic_value.title: ARIA 1.2, 6.2.4 Value (Characteristics of States and Properties)

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Autocomplete attribute has valid value

frontmatter.name: Autocomplete attribute has valid value
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the HTML `autocomplete` attribute has a correct value.

act-rules.title: Button has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Button has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `button` element has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: Element in sequential focus order has visible focus

frontmatter.name: Element in sequential focus order has visible focus
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each element in sequential focus order has some visible focus indication.

act-rules.title: Element marked as decorative is not exposed

frontmatter.name: Element marked as decorative is not exposed
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that elements marked as decorative either are not included in the accessibility tree, or have a presentational role.

wcag20:1.1.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. Only when this rule is applied to decorative content does a failure of 1.1.1 occur.

act-rules.title: Element with aria-hidden has no content in sequential focus navigation

frontmatter.name: Element with aria-hidden has no content in sequential focus navigation
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that elements with an `aria-hidden` attribute do not contain elements that are part of the sequential focus navigation and focusable.

using-aria:fourth.title: Using ARIA, 2.4 Fourth Rule of ARIA Use

act-rules.title: Element with lang attribute has valid language tag

frontmatter.name: Element with lang attribute has valid language tag
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that a non-empty `lang` attribute of an element in the page has a language tag with a known primary language subtag.

act-rules.title: Element with presentational children has no focusable content

frontmatter.name: Element with presentational children has no focusable content
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that elements with a role that makes its children presentational do not contain focusable elements.

act-rules.title: Element with role attribute has required states and properties

frontmatter.name: Element with role attribute has required states and properties
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that elements that have an explicit role also specify all required states and properties.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because browsers and assistive technologies will often fall back on a non-standard default value, which may be sufficient. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because browsers and assistive technologies will often fall back on a non-standard default value, which may be sufficient. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Form field has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Form field has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each form field element has a non-empty accessible name.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because 1.3.1 Info and Relationship requires that information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text, while 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value only requires an accessible name.

wcag20:2.5.3.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because 2.5.3 Label in Name requires that if a label is visible, the accessible name contains the label that is presented visually, while 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value only requires an accessible name.

act-rules.title: Headers attribute specified on a cell refers to cells in the same table element

frontmatter.name: Headers attribute specified on a cell refers to cells in the same table element
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `headers` attribute on a cell refer to other cells in the same `table` element.

act-rules.title: HTML images contain no text

frontmatter.name: HTML images contain no text
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that images of text are not used

act-rules.title: HTML page has lang attribute

frontmatter.name: HTML page has lang attribute
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that an HTML page has a non-empty `lang` attribute.

act-rules.title: HTML page has non-empty title

frontmatter.name: HTML page has non-empty title
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that a non-embedded HTML page has a non-empty title.

act-rules.title: HTML page lang attribute has valid language tag

frontmatter.name: HTML page lang attribute has valid language tag
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `lang` attribute of the root element of a non-embedded HTML page has a language tag with a known primary language subtag.

act-rules.title: HTML page title is descriptive

frontmatter.name: HTML page title is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the first title in an HTML web page describes the topic or purpose of that page.

act-rules.title: Iframe with interactive elements is not excluded from tab-order

frontmatter.name: Iframe with interactive elements is not excluded from tab-order
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements which contain keyboard focusable elements are not excluded from sequential focus navigation.

act-rules.title: Image accessible name is descriptive

frontmatter.name: Image accessible name is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the accessible names of images serve an equivalent purpose to the image.

assets: W3C; HTML and W3C logo
Wikimedia; Fireworks image
Adobe; PDF logo

act-rules.title: Image button has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Image button has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each image button element has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: Image has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Image has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each image either has a non-empty accessible name or is marked up as decorative.

act-rules.title: Important letter spacing in style attributes is wide enough

frontmatter.name: Important letter spacing in style attributes is wide enough
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `style` attribute is not used to prevent adjusting `letter-spacing` by using `!important`, except if it's at least 0.12 times the font size.

act-rules.title: Important line height in style attributes is wide enough

frontmatter.name: Important line height in style attributes is wide enough
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `style` attribute is not used to prevent adjusting `line-height` by using `!important`, except if it's at least 1.5 times the font size.

act-rules.title: Important word spacing in style attributes is wide enough

frontmatter.name: Important word spacing in style attributes is wide enough
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `style` attribute is not used to prevent adjusting `word-spacing` by using `!important`, except if it's at least `0.16` times the font size.

act-rules.title: Link has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Link has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each link has a non-empty accessible name.

wcag20:1.1.1.secondary: This success criterion is **related** to this rule. This is because HTML `area` elements are both links and non-text content. Most failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

assets: Image used in passed example 10 and failed example 9 is courtesy of NASA/JPL-Caltech.

act-rules.title: Menuitem has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Menuitem has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each element with a `menuitem` role has a non-empty accessible name.

assets: The "file.svg" icon is part of the Feather Icons package, which uses the [MIT license](https://github.com/feathericons/feather/blob/master/LICENSE).

act-rules.title: Meta element has no refresh delay

frontmatter.name: Meta element has no refresh delay
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `meta` element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

wcag20:2.2.4.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule allows redirects longer than 20 hours. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:3.2.5.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule allows redirects longer than 20 hours. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Meta element has no refresh delay (no exception)

frontmatter.name: Meta element has no refresh delay (no exception)
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `meta` element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

wcag20:2.2.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because this criterion allows redirects longer than 20 hours. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Meta viewport allows for zoom

frontmatter.name: Meta viewport allows for zoom
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `meta` element retains the user agent ability to zoom.

wcag21:1.4.10.secondary: This success criterion is **related** to this rule. This is because a page that cannot be zoomed up to 200% often does not reflow sufficiently either. Most failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Object element rendering non-text content has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Object element rendering non-text content has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `object` element rendering non-text content has a non-empty accessible name.

JFK's "We Choose the Moon" speech excerpt is courtesy of NASA.

act-rules.title: Orientation of the page is not restricted using CSS transforms

frontmatter.name: Orientation of the page is not restricted using CSS transforms
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that page content is not restricted to either `landscape` or `portrait` orientation using CSS transforms.

act-rules.title: Role attribute has valid value

frontmatter.name: Role attribute has valid value
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `role` attribute has a valid value.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the success criterion can be satisfied by an element's implicit role when the explicit role is incorrect. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the success criterion can be satisfied by an element's implicit role when the explicit role is incorrect. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Scrollable content can be reached with sequential focus navigation

frontmatter.name: Scrollable content can be reached with sequential focus navigation
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that scrollable elements or their descendants can be reached with sequential focus navigation so that they can be scrolled by keyboard

act-rules.title: Summary element has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Summary element has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `summary` element has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: SVG element with explicit role has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: SVG element with explicit role has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each SVG image element that is explicitly included in the accessibility tree has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: Text has enhanced contrast

frontmatter.name: Text has enhanced contrast
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the enhanced contrast requirement.

wcag20:1.4.3.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because this criterion has a lower minimum contrast. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Text has minimum contrast

frontmatter.name: Text has minimum contrast
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the minimal contrast requirement.

wcag20:1.4.6.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because this criterion has a higher minimum contrast. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: ARIA global properties not used where prohibited

frontmatter.name: ARIA global properties not used where prohibited
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that global WAI-ARIA properties are not on elements whose role prohibits them.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: ARIA required context role

frontmatter.name: ARIA required context role
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that an element with an explicit semantic role exists inside its required context.

act-rules.title: ARIA required ID references exist

frontmatter.name: ARIA required ID references exist
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that every ID reference required by WAI-ARIA exists

aria12:propcharacteristic_value.title: ARIA 1.2, 6.2.4 Value (Characteristics of States and Properties)

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not check for alternatives which may be accessible. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not check for alternatives which may be accessible. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

frontmatter.deprecated: This rule has been deprecated because the `aria-controls` attribute is no longer required by the combobox and scrollbar roles. This rule is not maintained anymore and should not be used.

act-rules.title: ARIA required owned elements

frontmatter.name: ARIA required owned elements
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that an element with a semantic role that restricts which elements it can own only owns such elements.

act-rules.title: ARIA state or property is permitted

frontmatter.name: ARIA state or property is permitted
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that WAI-ARIA states or properties are allowed for the element they are specified on.

aria12:state_property_processing.title: ARIA 1.2, 8.6 State and Property Attribute Processing

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:4.1.2.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not ignore irrelevant ARIA properties. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Attribute is not duplicated

frontmatter.name: Attribute is not duplicated
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that HTML and SVG starting tags do not contain duplicated attributes.
frontmatter.deprecated:
This rule has been deprecated because success criterion 4.1.1 has 
been removed in WCAG 2.2 and for WCAG 2.1 and 2.0 should be 
considered to always pass.

act-rules.title: Audio and visuals of video element have transcript

frontmatter.name: Audio and visuals of video element have transcript
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that non-streaming `video` elements have all audio and visual information available in a transcript.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **related** to this rule. This is because this criterion applies to a visible transcript.

wcag20:1.2.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because this criterion does not require a transcript when the audio-only or video-only is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Audio element content has text alternative

frontmatter.name: Audio element content has text alternative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `audio` elements have a text alternative available.

assets: JFK's "We Choose the Moon" speech excerpt is courtesy of NASA.

act-rules.title: Audio element content has transcript

frontmatter.name: Audio element content has transcript
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `audio` elements have a transcript that includes all auditory information.

act-rules.title: Audio element content is media alternative for text

frontmatter.name: Audio element content is media alternative for text
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the `audio` element is a media alternative for text on the page.

assets: JFK's "We Choose the Moon" speech excerpt is courtesy of NASA.

act-rules.title: Audio or video element avoids automatically playing audio

frontmatter.name: Audio or video element avoids automatically playing audio
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that audio or video that plays automatically does not have audio that lasts for more than 3 seconds or has an audio control mechanism to stop or mute it.

frontmatter.name: Audio or video element that plays automatically has a control mechanism
frontmatter.description: audio or video that plays automatically must have a control mechanism.

act-rules.title: Audio or video element that plays automatically has no audio that lasts more than 3 seconds

frontmatter.name: Audio or video element that plays automatically has no audio that lasts more than 3 seconds
frontmatter.description: `audio` or `video` that plays automatically does not output audio for more than 3 seconds.

frontmatter.name: Block of repeated content is collapsible
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that repeated blocks of content are collapsible

act-rules.title: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content

frontmatter.name: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each page has a mechanism to bypass repeated blocks of content.

act-rules.title: Content has alternative for visual reference

frontmatter.name: Content has alternative for visual reference
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that when content is identified through a visual reference, there are also non-visual references identifying the same content.

act-rules.title: Device motion based changes to the content can also be created from the user interface

frontmatter.name: Device motion based changes to the content can also be created from the user interface
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that changes to the content of a web page that result from device motion events can also be caused by user interface components.

act-rules.title: Device motion based changes to the content can be disabled

frontmatter.name: Device motion based changes to the content can be disabled
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that it is possible to disable any changes to the content of the web page resulting from device motion based events.

act-rules.title: Document has a landmark with non-repeated content

frontmatter.name: Document has a landmark with non-repeated content
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each page has an element with a landmark semantic role starting with non-repeated content

act-rules.title: Document has an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content

frontmatter.name: Document has an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that there is an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content in the page

assets: _The Three Kingdoms_ by Luo Guanzhong, translation by Yu Sumei (Tuttle publishing, 2014, ISBN 9780804843935)

act-rules.title: Document has heading for non-repeated content

frontmatter.name: Document has heading for non-repeated content
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the non-repeated content contains a heading

act-rules.title: Error message describes invalid form field value

frontmatter.name: Error message describes invalid form field value
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that text error messages provided when the user completes a form field with invalid values or using an invalid format, identify the cause of the error or how to fix the error.

act-rules.title: Focusable element has no keyboard trap

frontmatter.name: Focusable element has no keyboard trap
frontmatter.description: This rule checks for keyboard traps. This includes use of both standard and non-standard keyboard navigation to navigate through all content without becoming trapped.

act-rules.title: Focusable element has no keyboard trap via non-standard navigation

frontmatter.name: Focusable element has no keyboard trap via non-standard navigation
frontmatter.description: This rule checks if it is possible to use non-standard keyboard navigation to navigate through content where focus is trapped when using standard ways of keyboard navigation.

act-rules.title: Focusable element has no keyboard trap via standard navigation

frontmatter.name: Focusable element has no keyboard trap via standard navigation
frontmatter.description: This rule checks if it is possible to use standard keyboard navigation to navigate through all content on a web page without becoming trapped in any element.

act-rules.title: Form field label is descriptive

frontmatter.name: Form field label is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that labels describe the purpose of form field elements.

act-rules.title: Heading has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Heading has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each heading has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: Heading is descriptive

frontmatter.name: Heading is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that headings describe the topic or purpose of the content.

act-rules.title: HTML element language subtag matches language

frontmatter.name: HTML element language subtag matches language
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the primary language subtag of an element matches its default language

act-rules.title: HTML page lang and xml:lang attributes have matching values

frontmatter.name: HTML page lang and xml:lang attributes have matching values
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that both `lang` and `xml:lang` attributes on the root element of a non-embedded HTML page, have the same primary language subtag.
frontmatter.deprecated: This rule has been deprecated, as modern screen readers no longer use xml:lang when the lang attribute is given, regardless of which MIME type the page is served with. This rule is not maintained anymore and should not be used.

act-rules.title: HTML page language subtag matches default language

frontmatter.name: HTML page language subtag matches default language
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the primary language subtag of the page language matches the default language of the page

act-rules.title: Id attribute value is unique

frontmatter.name: Id attribute value is unique
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that all `id` attribute values on a single page are unique.
frontmatter.deprecated:
This rule has been deprecated because success criterion 4.1.1 has 
been removed in WCAG 2.2 and for WCAG 2.1 and 2.0 should be 
considered to always pass.

act-rules.title: Iframe element has non-empty accessible name

frontmatter.name: Iframe element has non-empty accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each `iframe` element has a non-empty accessible name.

act-rules.title: Iframe elements with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose

frontmatter.name: Iframe elements with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements with identical accessible names embed the same resource or equivalent resources.

act-rules.title: Image filename is accessible name for image

frontmatter.name: Image filename is accessible name for image
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that image elements that use their source filename as their accessible name do so without loss of information to the user.

act-rules.title: Image not in the accessibility tree is decorative

frontmatter.name: Image not in the accessibility tree is decorative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that visible `img`, `svg` and `canvas` elements that are ignored by assistive technologies are decorative.

assets: W3C
Wikimedia
Adobe

act-rules.title: Link in context is descriptive

frontmatter.name: Link in context is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the accessible name of a link together with its context describes its purpose.

wcag20:2.4.9.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule also considers the context of the link, in addition to the link text. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Link is descriptive

frontmatter.name: Link is descriptive
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that the accessible name of a link describes its purpose.

act-rules.title: Links with identical accessible names and same context serve equivalent purpose

frontmatter.name: Links with identical accessible names and same context serve equivalent purpose
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that links with identical accessible names in the same context resolve to the same or equivalent resources.

wcag20:2.4.9.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule also considers the context of the link, in addition to the link text. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Links with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose

frontmatter.name: Links with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that links with identical accessible names resolve to the same resource or equivalent resources.
frontmatter.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not consider the context of the link. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: No keyboard shortcut uses only printable characters

frontmatter.name: No keyboard shortcut uses only printable characters
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that if keyboard shortcuts are implemented using only printable characters, then there is a mechanism to disable the shortcut, or to remap the shortcut to use one or more non-printable character keys, or the shortcut for a user interface component is only available when that component has focus.

act-rules.title: Table header cell has assigned cells

frontmatter.name: Table header cell has assigned cells
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that each table header has assigned cells in a table element.

act-rules.title: Text content that changes automatically can be paused, stopped or hidden

frontmatter.name: Text content that changes automatically can be paused, stopped or hidden
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that for any text content that regularly changes automatically, there are instruments to pause, stop, or hide it or to control its changing frequency.

act-rules.title: Video element auditory content has accessible alternative

frontmatter.name: Video element auditory content has accessible alternative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `video` elements have an alternative for information conveyed through audio.

assets: Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Video element auditory content has captions

frontmatter.name: Video element auditory content has captions
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that captions are available for audio information in non-streaming `video` elements.

wcag20:1.2.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because the rule does not consider that the video may be a media alternative for text. Some of the failed examples satisfy this success criterion.

assets: Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Video element content is media alternative for text

frontmatter.name: Video element content is media alternative for text
frontmatter.description: This rule checks non-streaming `video` is a media alternative for text on the page.

assets: Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Video element visual content has accessible alternative

frontmatter.name: Video element visual content has accessible alternative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `video` elements with audio have an alternative for the video content as audio or as text.

wcag20:1.2.5.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule allows a media alternative in place of audio description. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

wcag20:1.2.8.secondary: This success criterion is **more strict** than this rule. This is because the rule allows audio description in place of a media alternative. Some of the passed examples do not satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Video element visual content has audio description

frontmatter.name: Video element visual content has audio description
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that non-streaming `video` elements have all visual information also contained in the audio.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)

act-rules.title: Video element visual content has description track

frontmatter.name: Video element visual content has description track
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming `video` elements are descriptive.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)

frontmatter.deprecated: This rule has been deprecated as descriptions tracks were removed in [#1665](https://github.com/act-rules/act-rules.github.io/pull/1665) as a way to provide video alternative. This rule is not maintained anymore and should not be used.

act-rules.title: Video element visual content has strict accessible alternative

frontmatter.name: Video element visual content has strict accessible alternative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `video` elements with audio have audio description.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)
Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative

frontmatter.name: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that `video` elements without audio have an alternative available.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)
Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Video element visual-only content has audio track alternative

frontmatter.name: Video element visual-only content has audio track alternative
frontmatter.description: Non-streaming `video` elements without audio must have an audio alternative.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)

act-rules.title: Video element visual-only content has description track

frontmatter.name: Video element visual-only content has description track
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming `video` elements, without audio, are descriptive.

assets: Rabbit video is © copyright 2008, Blender Foundation / [www.bigbuckbunny.org](https://www.bigbuckbunny.org)

frontmatter.deprecated: This rule has been deprecated as descriptions tracks were removed in [#1665](https://github.com/act-rules/act-rules.github.io/pull/1665) as a way to provide video alternative. This rule is not maintained anymore and should not be used.

act-rules.title: Video element visual-only content has transcript

frontmatter.name: Video element visual-only content has transcript
frontmatter.description: Non-streaming `video` elements without audio must have all visual information available in a transcript.

wcag20:1.3.1.secondary: This success criterion is **related** to this rule. This is because this criterion applies to a visible transcript.

wcag20:1.2.1.secondary: This success criterion is **less strict** than this rule. This is because this criterion does not require a transcript when the audio-only or video-only is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such. Some of the failed examples may satisfy this success criterion.

act-rules.title: Video element visual-only content is media alternative for text

frontmatter.name: Video element visual-only content is media alternative for text
frontmatter.description: This rule checks non-streaming silent `video` is a media alternative for text on the page.

assets: Web Accessibility Perspective videos by W3C WAI.

act-rules.title: Visible label is part of accessible name

frontmatter.name: Visible label is part of accessible name
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that interactive elements labeled through content have their visible label as part of their accessible name.

act-rules.title: Zoomed text node is not clipped with CSS overflow

frontmatter.name: Zoomed text node is not clipped with CSS overflow
frontmatter.description: This rule checks that text nodes are not unintentionally clipped by overflow, when a page is zoomed to 200% on 1280 by 1024 viewport;
